title: SENATE APPROVES ANTI-TERROR BILL BY A 91-TO-8 VOTE
body:
Senate approves Comprehensive Terrorism Prevention Act of 1995 by vote of 91-to-8; broad counterterrorism 
legislation will give law-enforcement officials expanded powers, make it easier to deport illegal aliens suspected of 
terrorism and limit most death row prisoners to one appeal in Federal court; gives Pres Clinton most of provisions 
he requested in counterterrorism measure he first proposed after bombing of World Trade Center in 1993; Sen Bob 
Dole lauds legislation; Clinton praises Senate for acting swiftly in wake of Oklahoma City bombing; similar measure 
is pending before House Judiciary Committee; photo (M)

Graphic
